question: Hot goddamn day!
answer: Haven't felt it a bit. Been inside with the air conditioner blastin' all day long.

question: Not even for lunch?
answer: I'm by myself today, ate my lunch outta the microwave.

question: Jesus Christ man, that microwave food will kill ya as quick as a bullet. Those burritos are only fit for a hippie high on weed. Pull me down a bottle of Jack Daniels. I'm gettin' tanked tonight.
answer: Whatsamatter?

question: Awww, it's just been a shitass day. Every inch of it hot and miserable. First off, Nadine at the Blue Chip got some sorta sick, so that Mongoloid boy of hers was workin' the grill. That fuckin' idiot don't know rat shit from Rice Krispies. I ate breakfast at nine, was pukin' up pigs in a blanket like a sick dog by ten thirty.
answer: Isn't there a law or something against retards serving food to the public?

question: Well, if there ain't there sure oughta be. Who knows what goes on inside Mongoloid's mind?
answer: You could sue the shit out of her, ya know. That kid belongs under a circus tent, not flippin' burgers. You could own that fuckin' place.

question: What the hell would I do with that grease pit? Besides, Nadine's got enough of a cross to bear just taking care of that potato head. Then all this Abilene shit happened. You heard about that bank robbery in Abilene, didn't ya?
answer: That's all that's been on the box all day. They killed some people didn't they?

question: Four Rangers, three cops, and two civilians. And they took a lady bank teller as a hostage. They'll probably make a run for the border, which would bring 'em this way. And if we get our hands on those shit asses, we're talking payback time. We'll get 'em all right. I gotta piss. I'm gonna use your commode.
answer: Knock yourself out. What do you want from me? I did what you said.

question: Knock yourself out. What do you want from me? I did what you said.
answer: Letting him use your toilet? No store does that.

question: He comes in here every day and we bullshit. He's used my toilet a thousand times. If I told him no, he'd know something was up.
answer: I want that son-of-a-bitch out outta here, in his car, and down the road or you can change the name of this place to "Benny's World of Blood." Were you giving that pig signals?

question: What? Are you kidding? I didn't do anything!
answer: He says you were scratching.

question: I wasn't scratching!
answer: You callin' him a liar?

question: What the fuck is wrong with you --
answer: Seth, he did it. You were by the beer cooler with your back turned. I was by the magazines, I could see his face. And I saw him mouth:

question: Start the car.
answer: You believe me don't cha?

question: Shut up and start the car. Richie? You okay?
answer: I'm not dead, but I'm definitely shot! I told you that bastard said, "Help us!"

question: Well that don't matter now, 'cause you got about two fuckin' seconds to live! Richie!
answer: Yeah?

question: When I count three, shoot out the bottles behind him!
answer: Gotcha!

question: One... Two... Three. What did I tell you? What did I tell you? Buy the road map and leave.
answer: What am I supposed to do, Seth? He recognized us.

question: He didn't recognize shit.
answer: Seth, I'm telling you, the way he looked at us -- you especially -- I knew he knew.

question: Why, just look at all this. You got your kitchen --
answer: -- you got your microwave --

question: -- you got your sink --
answer: -- you got your shower --

question: -- see this, television!
answer: Feel this, real wood paneling. That's real wood, too, not that fake stuff.

question: Dad, when I called the machine to check our messages there was one from Bethel Baptist. Mr.Franklin said he wouldn't permanently replace you until we came back. He said when we come home, if you still feel the same way --
answer: That's very nice of Ted, but I'll call him tomorrow and tell him not to bother waiting.

question: I didn't want to talk about this in front of Scott because he gets upset. But you don't believe in God anymore?
answer: Not enough to be a pastor. Look, I know this is hard on you kids. After Jenny's death, this is probably the last thing you need. But I can't do it any longer. My congregation needs spiritual leadership. Well, they can't get that from me anymore. My faith is gone. To answer your question, yes, I do believe in Jesus. But do I love them? No. After Jenny died, I just thought, what's the point?

question: It's just, all our lives you've been a pastor. For twenty years you've preached trust in the lord. And then one day you wake up and say fuck him?
answer: I didn't say fuck him. I'm just not connected anymore.

question: That happens, you'll get it back.
answer: Kate, give your old man a little credit. Every person who chooses the service of God as their life's work has something in common. I don't care if you're a preacher, a priest, a nun, a rabbi or a Buddhist monk. Many, many times during your life you'll look at your reflection in the mirror and ask yourself, am I a fool? We've all done it. I'm not going through a lapse. What I've experienced is closer to awakening. I'm not trying to shake your faith. I've just decided not to devote my life to God anymore.

question: What do you think Mom would say?
answer: Mom's got nothing to say, she's dead.

question: Whatcha think I want, ya mean old bastard? I wanna room.
answer: Do they have cable?

question: No.
answer: Do they have an X-rated channel?

question: No.
answer: Do they have a waterbed?

question: They don't have anything except four walls and a roof, and that's all we need. Open the door. We gotta do this fast. Don't say a word. You. Plant yourself in that chair. -- I said plant yourself. Plants don't talk. You wanna get on my good side? Just sit still and don't make a peep. Let me help you. How's it feel?
answer: How ya think, it hurts like a son-of-a-bitch.

question: I got both rooms on either side of us, so we don't gotta worry about eavesdropping assholes. How's that feel? You okay?
answer: Feels good.

question: I'm gonna go get the money. It's about five o'clock. What time does it get dark around here? Good. I'm going towards the border to check things out while it's still daylight. Call Carlos and arrange the rendezvous.
answer: Hey, when you talk to him, see if you can arrange a better deal than thirty percent.

question: That's their standard deal, brother. They ain't about to change it for us.
answer: Did you even to try to negotiate?

question: These guys ain't spic fire cracker salesman from Tijuana. They don't even know the meaning of the word "barter". You wanna stay in El Ray? You give them thirty percent of your loot. It's scripture. So it is written, so shall it be done. You want sanctuary, you pay the price, and the price is thirty percent.
answer: All I'm saying --

question: -- This conversation is over. Now, we need to have a talk. What's your name? Hello, Gloria, I'm Seth and that's my brother Richie. Let's cut to the chase. I'm gonna ask you a question and all I want is a yes or no answer. Do you want to live through this? Good. Then let me explain the house rules. Follow the rules, we'll get along like a house on fire. Rule number one Rule number two Rule number three Open your eyes. Gloria, you hang in there, follow the rules, and don't fuck with us, you'll get out of this alive. I give you my word. Okay? I'll be back in a bit.
answer: Wanna come up here on the bed and watch TV with me? Come on.

question: This bloody crime spree started just a week ago today. The oldest of the two brothers... ...Seth Gecko was serving time in Rolling's Kansas State Penitentiary for his part in the 1988 Scott City bank robbery in which two law enforcement officers lost their lives. Having served eight years of his twenty-two year sentence, Seth Gecko was brought to Wichita Municipal court house for his first parole hearing. It was while at the court house that this man... ... his younger brother Richard Gecko, a known armed robber and sex offender, pulled off a daring daylight escape... ...resulting in the death of four Wichita law enforcement officers, and this woman... ...Heide Vogel, sixth grade teacher who was run over by the Geckos during a high speed pursuit through downtown Wichita. From there the brothers traveled from Kansas through Oklahoma... ...into the great state of Texas, and then finally... ...into Abilene. The list of the dead climbed up three more notches since our last telecast. Officer Sherman Goodell, who was in intensive care following the gun battle outside of the Valley Federal bank building... ...died about forty-five minutes ago at Hopkins General hospital. And about six hours ago, during a daylight liquor store robbery in Big Springs, The Gecko Brothers killed another Texas Ranger... ...Earl McGraw... ...and liquor store clerk Pet Bottoms. Then they proceeded to burn the store down to the ground. That changes the death toll to fifteen. Five Texas Rangers... Eight police officers Three civilians. And one hostage... ... bank teller and mother of four, Gloria Hill. Heading the case to bring these fugitives to justice is FBI agent Stanley Chase. We talked with agent Chase earlier this afternoon.
answer: For the time being we are very confident we will apprehend the fugitives in the next forty-eight hours. The Bureau, local law enforcement and the Texas Rangers have all joined forces in forming a dragnet to snare Seth and Richard Gecko.

question: Agent Chase, does it appear that they are heading for Mexico.
answer: Yes, it does, Kelly. We have already alerted the Mexican authorities. They intend to cooperate every way possible in bringing these fugitives to justice.

question: Are you optimistic about the safety of the hostage they took in Abilene, Gloria Hill?
answer: We've received no news one way or the other. We can only hope for the best.

question: What about the report from an eyewitness at the liquor store who said one of the brothers was shot?
answer: This can't be confirmed at this time, but we do believe it to be true. We have reason to believe it was the youngest brother Richard, and he was shot in the vicinity of his neck and shoulders by the store's clerk.

question: Is it safe to assume that because the death count involved and the loss of life of law enforcement officers, that the Bureau, the Rangers and the police force are taking this manhunt personally?
answer: I would say that's a very safe assumption.

question: Is it safe to assume since the law enforcement authorities in the great state of Texas are homosexuals of a sick and deviate nature, that they will be too busy fucking each other up the ass to actually catch The Gecko Brothers? I would say that's a very safe assumption. Shit, I started to get worried. Where the fuck ya been?
answer: Sight seein'.

question: What'd ya see?
answer: Cops.

question: Didya look at the border?
answer: Yeah, I saw the border. Through binoculars from on top of a high building. That's about as close as I risked getting. What's the TV say?

question: They're going to apprehend us in forty-eight hours.
answer: I gotta figure a way to get across that goddamn border. Longer we fuck around El Paso our lives ain't worth a shit.

question: Look, fuck the border. Let's just dig in and wait for things to cool down.
answer: Richie, it's gonna get a lot fuckin' worse before it gets any fuckin' better. We showed our ass in Texas. We killed Texas fuckin' Rangers. They ain't gonna stop lookin' till they find us, and when they find us, they're gonna kill us. Texans take it very personal when ya kill their law enforcement officers. The El Paso police have already started a motel and hotel search for us.

question: How do you know?
answer: I heard it on the radio. We gotta get our asses into Mexico tonight. Carlos is gonna meet us tomorrow morning at a rendezvous on the other side, then Carlos and his boys will escort us to El Ray and -- Where's the woman?

question: What?
answer: What'd ya mean, what? The fuckin' woman, the hostage. Where the fuck is she, Richard!?

question: She's in the other room.
answer: What the fuck is she doin' there?!

question: Seth, before you open the door, let me explain what happened.
answer: Oh, Richard, what's wrong with you?

question: Now, Seth, before you flip out, let me just explain what happened.
answer: Yeah, explain it to me. I need an explanation. What's the matter with you?

question: There's nothing wrong with me, brother. That woman tried to escape and I did what I had to do.
answer: No. That woman wouldn't of said shit if she had a mouthful.

question: Wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong, wrong! Once you left, she became a whole different person.
answer: Is it me? Is it my fault?

question: It's not your fault, it's her fault!
answer: Is this my fault? Do you think this is what I am?

question: What?
answer: This is not me! I am a professional fucking thief. I steal money. You try to stop me, god help you. But I don't kill people I don't have to, and I don't rape women. What you doin' ain't how it's done. Do you understand?

question: Seth, if you were me --
answer: Just say yes! Nothing else, just say yes.

question: Yes.
answer: Yes, Seth, I understand.

question: Yes, Seth, I understand.
answer: We get into Mexico, it's gonna be sweet Rosemary, hundred-proof liquor, and rice and beans. None of this shit's gonna matter.

question: I can't believe he's stopping here. This place looks totally cruddy. Dad, why are we stopping here?
answer: There's nothing wrong with this place.

question: It's a flop house.
answer: It's not a flop house. It's basic and simple. That doesn't make it a flop house.

question: If it doesn't have a pool, we're looking for a new place.
answer: It has a bed. That's all I care about.

question: Other places have beds, they also have cable TV, a gym, room service... Owww, my head.
answer: Watch where you're going!

question: What's the story with you two? You a couple of fags?
answer: He's my son.

question: How does that happen? You don't look Japanese.
answer: Neither does he. He looks Vietnamese.

question: Oh, well, excuse me all to hell.
answer: What's this about, money?

question: Richard! Not when you get around to it, now. You, Gidget, go in the bathroom and put on some clothes. You got three minutes. One second longer, I shoot your father in the face. Do you understand what I just said?
answer: Yes.

question: Do you believe me?
answer: Yes.

question: You damn well better. Go.
answer: Look, if you want the motor home, just take it and get out.

question: Sorry, Pops, it ain't gonna be that easy. Get ready to move out, we're all going on a little ride.
answer: Not a chance.

question: Come again?
answer: If you're taking people, take me. But my kids aren't going anywhere with you.

question: Sorry, I need everybody.
answer: My children are not going with you, and that's that.

question: That's not fuckin' that... this is fuckin' this. Go sit over there. I ain't got time to fuck around with you, so I'll make this simple. Take your kids and get in the car, or I'll execute all three of you right now. What's it gonna be, yes or no answer?
answer: Yes.

question: Excuse me.
answer: What?

question: Where are you taking us?
answer: Mexico.

question: What's in Mexico?
answer: Mexicans.

question: Jacob Fuller. Jacob, that's biblical, ain't it? What am I askin' for, of course it is. What are their names?
answer: Scott and Kate.

question: Scott and Kate... Kate and Scott... Scott Fuller... Kate Fuller... Who's this?
answer: My wife.

question: Where is the little lady?
answer: In heaven.

question: She's dead?
answer: Yes, she is.

question: How'd she die?
answer: Auto wreck.

question: Come on, gimme some more details. How'd it happen? Some fuckin' drunk kill her?
answer: No. It was a rainy night, the brakes on the car weren't great. She had to stop suddenly. She slid on the road, she crashed, she died.

question: Died instantly?
answer: Not quite. She was trapped in the wreck for about six hours before she passed on.

question: Whewww! Those acts of God really stick it in and break it off, don't they?
answer: Yes, they do.

question: Is this real?
answer: Yes.

question: I've seen one of these before. A friend of mine had himself declared a minister of his own religion. Away to fuck the IRS. Is that what you're doing, or are you the real McCoy?
answer: Real McCoy.

question: You're a preacher?
answer: I was a minister.

question: Was? As in not anymore?
answer: Yes.

question: Why'd ya quit?
answer: I think I've gotten about as up close and personal with you as I'm gonna get. Now if you need me like I think you need me, you're not gonna kill me 'cause I won't answer your stupid, prying questions. So, with all due respect, mind your own business.

question: I seem to have touched a nerve. Don't be so sensitive, Pops, let's keep this friendly. But you're right, enough with the getting to know you shit. Now, there's two ways we can play this hand. One way is me and you go round an' round all fuckin' night. The other way, is we reach some sort of an understanding. Now, if we go down that first path at the end of the day, I'll win. But we go down the second, we'll both win. Now, I don't give a rat's ass about you or your fuckin' family. Y'all can live forever or die this second and I don't care which. The only things I do care about are me that son-of-a-bitch in the back, and our money. And right now I need to get those three things into Mexico. Now, stop me if I'm wrong, but I take it you don't give a shit about seeing me and my brother receiving justice, or the bank getting its money back. Right now all you care about is the safety of your daughter, your son and possibly yourself. Am I correct?
answer: Yes.

question: I thought so. You help us get across the border without incident, stay with us the rest of the night without trying anything funny, and in the morning we'll let you and your family go. That way everybody gets what they want. You and your kids get out of this alive and we get into Mexico. Everybody's happy.
answer: How do I know you'll keep your word?

question: Jesus Christ, Pops, don't start with this shit.
answer: You want me to sit here and be passive. The only way being passive in this situation makes sense is if I believe you'll let us go. I'm not there yet. You have to convince me you're telling the truth.

question: Look, dickhead, the only thing you need to be convinced about is that you're stuck in a situation with a coupla real mean motor scooters. I don't wanna hafta worry about you all fuckin' night. And I don't think you wanna be worrying about my brother's intentions toward your daughter all night. You notice the way he looked at her, didn't ya?
answer: Yes.

question: Didn't like it, did ya?
answer: No, I didn't.

question: Didn't think so. So, as I was saying, I'm willing to make a deal. You behave, get us into Mexico, and don't try to escape. I'll keep my brother off your daughter and let you all loose in the morning.
answer: You won't let him touch her?

question: I can handle Richie, don't worry. I give you my word. My words, my law. Better you not take it, and that's just where we are, then take it and not mean it.
answer: If he touches her, I'll kill him. I don't give a fuck how many guns you have, nothing will stop me from killing him.

question: Fair enough. You break your word, I'll kill all of you. Kate, honey!
answer: Yeah.

question: You must have a bible in here, don't cha?
answer: Yeah, we got a bible.

question: Did ya mean what you said back there?
answer: What?

question: In the room. Were you serious, or were you just foolin' around? I'm just bringing it up, 'cause if you really want me to do that for you, I will.
answer: Do what?

question: What you said to me in the room.
answer: What did I say?

question: You asked me if I would --
answer: Richard!

question: What?
answer: I told you to watch those kids, I didn't say talk to 'em. You guys ain't got nothin' to say to one another. So cut the chatter.

question: We'll talk later.
answer: Okay everybody, it's show time. Richie, take Kate in the bathroom. Scott, you come up front with your daddy.

question: Okay everybody, it's show time. Richie, take Kate in the bathroom. Scott, you come up front with your daddy.
answer: I'm telling you, don't hurt her.

question: As long as you're cool, she'll be cool. What're ya gonna say?
answer: I don't have the slightest idea.

question: This isn't gonna work.
answer: Shut up. It's gonna work just fine,

question: I just want to go on record as saying this is a bad idea.
answer: Duly noted. Now, shut up.

question: They're gonna search the van.
answer: As long as you don't act like a fuckin' nut, we'll be just fine.

question: What does that mean?
answer: What?

question: You just called me a fuckin' nut.
answer: No, I didn't.

question: Yes, you did. You said as long as I don't act like a fuckin' nut, implying that I've been acting like a fuckin' nut.
answer: Take a pill, kid. I just meant stay cool.

question: You meant that, but you meant the other, too.
answer: This ain't the time, Richard.

question: Fuck those spic pigs! You called me a fuckin' nut, and where I come from, that stops the train on its tracks.
answer: Keep your voice down.

question: Have you forgotten about your sister?
answer: They're gonna kill us. They get us across the border, they're gonna take us out in the desert and shoot us.

question: If they get over the border, they're gonna let us go.
answer: Dad, I watch those reality shows. They never let anybody go. Any cop will tell you, in a situation like this, you get a chance, you go for it. This is our chance.

question: What about Kate?
answer: They're gonna kill her anyway. At least now with all these cops we've got a fighting chance.

question: Son, I have this situation under control. I know exactly what I'm doing. You're going to have to trust me on this.
answer: If trusting you means trusting those fuckin' killers, I can't do that. If you don't tell the cops, I will.

question: Now, you listen to me. You ain't gonna do a goddamn fucking thing, you hear me! Nobody cares what you think, I'm running this show, I make the decisions.
answer: He's running the show.

question: I'm running the show. I make the plays, and you back the plays I make. Stop thinking with your fucking balls. Kate in a room with a couple of desperate men with nothing to fucking lose ain't the time to "go for it." I need your cover. Cover my ass.
answer: How many with you?

question: Just my son and I.
answer: What is your purpose in Mexico?

question: What was that?
answer: Oh, that's just my daughter in the bathroom.

question: You said it was just you and your son.
answer: I meant me, my son and my daughter.

question: Open the door. I'm coming aboard.
answer: I'm in the bathroom.

question: It's the Border Patrol. Open up.
answer: It's open. Do you mind? Shut the fucking door.

question: Then stop, 'cause that's where we're going. C'mon, kid, wake up. Don't make a career out of it. You okay?
answer: Yeah, I think so. What happened?

question: I don't know, you just passed out.
answer: I did?

question: Yeah, we were just standing there. You said something about your shoulder hurting, then you just hit the ground like a sack of potatoes.
answer: Really?

question: Yeah, when you fell your head smacked the toilet hard. It scared the shit outta me. Sure you're okay?
answer: Yeah, I guess. I'm just a little fucked up.

question: Well, let me tell ya something, gonna clear your head right up. We are officially Mexicans.
answer: What?

question: We are... "South of the border down Mexico way."
answer: We are?

question: Yep. We're heading for the rendezvous right now. We get there, we pound booze till Carlos shows up, he escorts us to El Ray. And then me and you, brother, kick fuckin' back. How ya like them apples?
answer: Far out. Where are my glasses?

question: They broke when you fell.
answer: Oh, fuck, Seth, that's my only pair!

question: Don't worry about it, we'll get you some glasses.
answer: What dya mean, don't worry about it. Of course I'm gonna worry about it, I can't fuckin' see.

question: When we get to El Ray, I'll take care of it.
answer: Yeah, like a Mexican hole-in-the-wall's gonna have my fuckin' prescription.

question: Shit, I been to bars make this place look like a fuckin' 4-H club.
answer: I gotta say I'm with Jacob on this. I been to some fucked up places in my time, but that place is fucked up.

question: Aww-w, whatsa matter, is the little baby too afraid to go into the big scary bar?
answer: That's what you think?

question: That's how you're lookin', Richie.
answer: I'm lookin' scared?

question: That's what you look like.
answer: You know what you look like?

question: No, Richie, what do I look like?
answer: You're lookin' green.

question: How?
answer: Where are you right now?

question: What do you mean?
answer: Where are you?

question: I'm here with you.
answer: No, you're not. You're sippin' margaritas in El Ray. But we're not in El Ray. We're here -- getting ready to go in there. You're so pleased with yourself about getting into Mexico, you think the job's down. It ain't. Get back on the clock. That's a fuck-with-you-bar. We hang around there for a coupla hours, in all likelihood, we'll get fucked with. So get your shit together, brother.

question: My shit is together.
answer: It don't look together.

question: Well, it is. Just because I'm happy doesn't mean I'm on vacation. You're just not used to seein' me happy, 'cause it's been about fifteen fuckin' years since I been happy. But my shit is forever together.
answer: Okay, just checkin'.

question: Now this is my kinda place! I could become a regular. Whiskey!
answer: You can't come in here.

question: What dya mean?
answer: This is a private club. You're not welcome.

question: Are you tellin' me I'm not good enough to drink here?
answer: This bar is for bikers and truckers only. You, get out!

question: Walk, Pendaho.
answer: Take your hand off me.

question: I'm going to count to three.
answer: No, I'm going to count to three.

question: Uno...
answer: Two..

question: Who else?
answer: Pass.

question: Why not, against your religion?
answer: No, I do drink, I'm just not drinking now.

question: Why are you so agitated?
answer: I'm still stewing about that ape laying hands on me. And that fuckin' bartender sticks a weed up my ass, too.

question: He backed down.
answer: He's smilin' at us. But behind his smile, he's sayin', "Fuck you Jack." I hear that loud and clear.

question: What are you going to do?
answer: I'm gonna just sit here and drain this bottle. And when I've drunk the last drop, if I still feel then, the way I feel now, I'm gonna take this bottle and break it over his melon head.

question: Before we stepped in here, you told all of us to be cool. That means you, too.
answer: I never said do what I do, I said do what I say.

question: Are you so much a fucking loser, you can't tell when you've won?
answer: What did you call me?

question: Nothing. I didn't make a statement. I asked a question. Would you like me to ask it again? Very well. Are you such a loser you can't tell when you've won? The entire state of Texas, along with the FBI, is looking for you. Did they find you? No. They couldn't. They had every entrance to the border covered. There's no way you could get across. Did you? Yes, you did. You've won, Seth, enjoy it.
answer: Jacob, I want you to have a drink with me. I insist. To your family.

question: To yours. Now, is your shit together?
answer: Forever together. In that camper out there I saw a guitar. I take it that's yours.

question: Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Now that's what I call a fuckin' show! Earth to Richie. Don't you wanna ask your new friend to join us?
answer: Yeah.

question: Well, then ask her, dumb ass.
answer: Por favor, Senorita. Would you care to join us?

question: Hold him down. Richie, here's the peace in death I could never give you in life.
answer: Are you okay?

question: Peachy! Why shouldn't I be? The world's my oyster, except for the fact that I just rammed a wooden stake in my brother's heart because he turned into a vampire, even though I don't believe in vampires. Aside from that unfortunate business, everything's hunky-dory.
answer: I'm really sorry.

question: Get this bastard off of me!
answer: Is everybody okay? Okay, does anybody here know what's going on?

question: Yeah, I know what's going on. We got a bunch of fuckin' vampires outside trying to get inside and suck our fuckin' blood! That's it, plain and simple. And I don't wanna hear any bullshit about "I don't believe in vampires" because I don't fuckin' believe in vampires either. But I do believe in my own two fuckin' eyes, and with my two eyes I saw fuckin' vampires! Now, does everybody agree we're dealin' with vampires. You too, preacher?
answer: I'm like you. I don't believe in vampires, but I believe in what I saw.

question: Good for you. Now, since we all believe we're dealing with vampires, what do we know about vampires? Crosses hurt vampires. Do you have a cross?
answer: In the Winnebago.

question: Back in '72 I was in Nam, trapped behind enemy lines, lying in a rat hole with my entire squad dead. They thought they killed everybody, and except for me, they were right. But it wasn't for lack of trying. A grenade blew up right next to me, that's why I'm so pretty.
answer: Stop fucking saying that! That bite weren't nothin'. It just hurt like a son-of-a-bitch, that's all. It barely punched the skin.

question: ...and then when I came back to my senses, I realized I had killed the entire V.C. squadron single handedly. My bayonet had blood and chunks of yellow flesh on it like some cannibal shish kabob. And to this day I don't have the slightest idea how I --
answer: THIRST!

question: I been bit! He fuckin' bit me! You're dead, mother fucker! You're gonna bite me! You just turned me into a vampire, asshole!
answer: What are you gonna do about it?

question: Open the door.
answer: Did he...?

question: Yep.
answer: Fuck, piss, shit! Mother fuckin' vampires! Mother fuckin' vampires! Goddamn mother fuckin' vampires! You all are gonna fuckin' die! I'm gonna fuckin' kill every last one of you godless pieces of shit!

question: No, I'm not. I've been bit. In effect, I'm already dead. Children, listen to me. I love you two more than anybody. And I just want you to know you've made me proud all your lives. But never more so than tonight. And I wish we could sit here and cry till I pass on, but we can't. Because I'm not going to pass on. I'm going to turn into a monster. And when I do, I'm going to be dangerous. But before that happens, just know I love you. Now, I'd say in the next twenty or thirty minutes our friends outside will bust in this door. And I'll probably turn into a vampire within the hour. Now, you have two choices. You can wait for me to turn, then deal with me, then wait for them to burst inside here and the three of you will deal with them. Or, we can kick open that door and the four of us can hit 'em with everything we have, and carve a path right through 'em to front entrance. But if we're gonna go at 'em, we gotta go at 'em now. I confused them, I scared them, I took them off guard. But they're going to get unconfused, they're going to get unscared, they're going to get together and they're going to hit that door like a ton of bricks. And when that moment arrives, we gotta be ready. What's this stuff?
answer: My guess is that this little dive's been feeding on nomad road waifs like bikers and truckers for a longtime. This is probably some of the shipments they stole off the trucks.

question: Well, I say lets tear this place apart for weapons. So when they burst through that door, we'll make 'em wish they never did.
answer: I don't give a shit about living or dying anymore. I just want to send as many of these devils back to hell as I can.

question: Amen. Before we go any further, I need you three to promise me something. I'll fight with you to the bitter end, but when I turn into one of them, I won't be Jacob anymore. I'll be a lap dog of Satan. I want you three to promise you'll take me down, no different from the rest.
answer: I promise.

question: Why don't I believe you? I'm gonna ask you two again, then I want you to swear to God that you'll kill me. If you don't, I'm gonna just kill myself right now. Now, since you need me I think you better swear. Kate, do you swear to God that when I turn into one of the undead, you'll kill me? Kate, we don't have all day, so I'm only gonna count to five. One...two... three... four...
answer: Okay, okay, I promise I'll do it!

question: Not good enough, swear to God.
answer: I swear to God, our father, that when you change into one of the undead, I will kill you.

question: Good girl. Now, Scott, we have even less time, so I'm only giving you the count of three. One...
answer: You don't believe in suicide.

question: It's not suicide if you're already dead. Two...
answer: Okay, I'll kill you when you change, I swear to God in Jesus Christ's name.

question: How many bullets left, kid?
answer: Not many.

question: Well, when you run out of weapons, just start cold cocking 'em. Make 'em sing for their supper.
answer: Should I use the last bullets on us?

question: You use 'em on the first couple of these parasites that try to bite you. Shoot more holes! Carlos! Help us, bash the door. Bash the door in!
answer: Danny, Manny, knock down the door. Hurry, hurry! What the fuck was going on in there? Whatsamatter with you? Are you crazy?

question: Why the fuck, outta all the god forsaken shit holes in Mexico, did you have us rendezvous at that place?
answer: I don't know, one place's as good as another.

question: Have you ever been there before?
answer: No, but I passed by it a couple of times. It's out in the middle of nowhere. It seems like a rowdy place, so there wouldn't be a lot of police. And it's open from dusk till dawn. You said meet you in the morning.

question: Well, because you picked that place out of a hat, my brother's dead now. And this girl's family's dead.
answer: I'm sorry to hear that. What were they, psychos?

question: Did they look like psychos? They were fuckin' vampires. Psychos don't explode when sunlight hits 'em, I don't care how crazy they are.
answer: Oh, Seth, how can I ever make it up to you?

question: You can't, but fifteen percent instead of thirty for my stay at El Ray is a good start.
answer: Twenty-eight.

question: Jesus Christ, Carlos, my brother's dead and he's not coming back, and it's all your fault. Twenty.
answer: You like the car?

question: I said new, this is an '90.
answer: It's hardly been used at all. I got it from a drug dealer who only drove it 5 times in as many years. Swear to God. That's like new.

question: So do I just follow you?
answer: Yeah, follow us.

question: So let's do it.
answer: Vamanos!
